summary: Email correspondence between FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel regarding the copying and transfer of digital evidence (Epstein items) to the Southern District of New York. The email discusses the status of copying data to a drive for submission, with some items requiring hardware data recovery.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The individual is coordinating the copying of digital evidence from Epstein items to a drive for submission to the Southern District of New York, noting that one item is still copying and two servers need hardware data recovery.

events.title: Evidence copying and transfer coordination
events.description: Email exchange regarding the status of copying digital evidence from Epstein items to a drive for submission to the Southern District of New York, with one item still copying and two servers requiring hardware data recovery.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: Digital evidence from Epstein items was being copied to a drive for submission to the Southern District of New York as of July 22, 2020.
One item was still copying and would not be available until the next day, and two servers required hardware data recovery.
The email correspondence was between FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel, indicating ongoing investigative work on the Epstein case at that time.
